intro: Picris spinosa, commonly known as prickly gooseweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are deeply lobed with spiny margins. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
